openblocks.yacodeblocks
Class WorkspaceController

java.lang.Object
  openblocks.yacodeblocks.WorkspaceController
All Implemented Interfaces:
WorkspaceListener, IWorkspaceController
public class WorkspaceController
extends Object
implements IWorkspaceController, WorkspaceListener

Modified from generic codeblocks WorkspaceController to be specific to Young Android

Author:
sharon@google.com (Sharon Perl)

persistCodeblocksSourceFile

public void persistCodeblocksSourceFile(boolean synchronous)
                                 throws SaveException
All saving of the codeblocks source file should be done with this method. If the workspace has changed due to user action within Codeblocks, this call will save the codeblocks source file to the source save path that is associated with the currently loaded project. If the source save path is null or empty, an exception will be thrown. If a save is unnecessary this method will return a value of false, but still return normally.

Parameters:
synchronous - if true, waits until the save has happened before returning
Throws:
SaveException - if the save should have occurred, but it failed for some reason.

takeSnapshot

protected CodeblocksSourceOutput takeSnapshot(boolean tellAutosaver)
                                       throws SaveException
Throws:
SaveException

loadFreshWorkspace

public void loadFreshWorkspace(String newCodeblocksSourceSavePath,
                               Element languageDefinition)
Loads a fresh workspace based on the specified language definition file. If languageDefinition is null, no new language definition will be loaded. The block canvas will have no live blocks. Changes made to the workspace by executing this method will not trigger the autosaver.

Parameters:
newCodeblocksSourceSavePath - The path that the codeblocks source should be saved to for this project. If null or the empty string, this project will not be able to be saved.
languageDefinition -

If we're connected to the phone, generates Yail for all the definitions and downloads to the phone.

Parameters:
formProperties - contents of the form properties file

sendCurrentProjectDefinitionsToRepl

public void sendCurrentProjectDefinitionsToRepl()
If we're connected to the phone, first gets the current form properties from the server and then generates Yail for all the definitions and downloads to the phone.

                                    throws IOException,

getProjectDefinitionsForRepl

                                    throws YailGenerationException
Returns:
yail code for all the definitions in a format suitable for feeding to the REPL on a phone
Throws:
YailGenerationException

getYailForProject

public String getYailForProject(org.json.JSONObject formProperties,
                                boolean reloadFirst,
                                boolean compileUnattachedBlocks,
                                boolean forRepl)
                         throws YailGenerationException
Returns the YAIL code for this workspace given the current set of form properties. Changes made to the workspace by executing this method will not trigger the autosaver.

Parameters:
reloadFirst - whether or not the workspace should be reloaded with the formProperties before generating the Yail.
compileUnattachedBlocks - will compile clumps that aren't definitions true only for testing
forRepl - instructs BlockParser to warn less about runtime errors.
Returns:
Yail
Throws:
YailGenerationException - if there are compile errors.

testGetYail

public String testGetYail(String formProperties)
                   throws YailGenerationException
Returns the YAIL code for testing. Allows certain illegal programs fragments to generate code.

Parameters:
formProperties - a JSONObject representation of the components on this form and their properties.
Throws:
YailGenerationException

haveProject

public boolean haveProject()
Returns true iff we currently have a project loaded

Specified by:
haveProject in interface IWorkspaceController

loadProperties

public void loadProperties(String formProperties)
                    throws LoadException
Used to sync new form properties that change the components for a particular project. Changes made to the workspace by executing this method will not trigger the autosaver. Cannot be called from the EventDispatch (UI) thread. Throws LoadException if any errors are detected during the load

Parameters:
formProperties - a String representation of the JSON that represents the components and their properties.
Throws:
LoadException

loadSourceAndProperties

public void loadSourceAndProperties(String newCodeblocksSourceSavePath,
                                    String codeblocksSource,
                                    String formProperties,
                                    Map<String,String> assetFiles,
                                    String projectName)
                             throws LoadException
Loads a new project, or a new form in the same project, from its form properties and codeblocks source. After the project has loaded the autosaver will be reset. Cannot be called from the EventDispatch (UI) thread. Throws LoadException if any errors are detected during the load

Parameters:
newCodeblocksSourceSavePath - the path that the ExternalController should save the CodeblocksSource to.
codeblocksSource - can be empty but not null
formProperties -
assetFiles - a map containing names of asset files
projectName - the name of the project
Throws:
LoadException

doLoadBlocks

protected void doLoadBlocks(String codeblocksSource)
                     throws LoadException
Load the blocks from a save string. Uses the current save path. Will not restart the phone app if it is running

Parameters:
codeblocksSource - The save string for the workspace
Throws:
LoadException

startCodeblocks

public void startCodeblocks(ExternalController ec,
                            AndroidController ac)
Start codeblocks from an external controller (e.g., a server invoked by JavaWebStart).

Parameters:
ec - Provides a way for us to give the external controller a handle on the WorkspaceController once it is initialized.
ac - Give us a pointer to the Android-specific calls.

setExternalController

public void setExternalController(ExternalController ec)
Provides a way for us to give the workspace controller a handle on an externalController once it is initialized. Used by YaBlockCompilerTest.

workspaceEventOccurred

public void workspaceEventOccurred(WorkspaceEvent event)
Handles workspace events that require sending stuff to the phone. Note(sharon): this code used to be in ComponentBlockManager and was in a synchronized method. I've removed the synchronization here because it causes deadlocks for WorkspaceController and seems unnecessary.

Specified by:
workspaceEventOccurred in interface WorkspaceListener
Parameters:
event - WorkspaceEvent object holding information regarding the triggered event.

mouseMovedOnCanvas

Specified by:
